intro: Belosynapsis, commonly known as the false broomweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish or brownish flowers arranged in composite heads. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Belosynapsis species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. These plants are sometimes considered invasive in certain regions due to their rapid growth and ability to colonize new areas.
